title: Empathetic Science Education Design Project

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Science curriculum design emphasizing team collaboration and empathetic design in smartphone-centric constrained tech environments

learning_goals: Learners analyze the cognitive and emotional characteristics of elementary science education targets (ages 8–13) in teams of 3–4, produce a report (3+ pages), and propose a science education design plan (1 topic, 3 lessons) reflecting their analysis, meeting peer and instructor evaluation criteria (4+ points on a 5-point scale).
Learners perform iterative design prototyping at least three times using smartphone-centric collaboration tools in constrained technical environments

Learners revise a science education design incorporating at least three empathetic design elements (learner engagement, accessibility, multicultural sensitivity) based on formative assessment feedback (≥3 rounds), achieving ≥4 points (12/15) on the instructor’s rubric (5-point scale).

resources: Real-world projects linked with nonprofit organizations
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
